intro: Saussurea nishiokae, commonly known as the Nishioka saussurea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Japan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stem and yellowish-green flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine or subalpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in late summer to early autumn. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
